TopicTitle: Anyone here owning an Oculus Rift?

Articles.Content:
I'd like to see whether anyone here owns an Oculus Rift. As I'm planning to develop a nice first-person mod for KSP, I'd also like to add Oculus Rift support but sadly I don't own one nor could I afford one in near future.

Would anyone with an Oculus Rift like to help me develop something like this?

This would be like developing a mod for a fringe, of a fringe of a fringe. Seriously how many people are intrested in this and how did you imagin developing this mod when you don't even have access to a Oculus Rift?

This would be like developing a mod for a fringe, of a fringe of a fringe. Seriously how many people are intrested in this and how did you imagin developing this mod when you don't even have access to a Oculus Rift?

I could possibly get access to a Oculus Rift, although it wouldn't be mine and I wouldn't have the opportunity to test everything all the time. I could only use it occasionally. So I'd like to have someone who can do this for me.

Developing something for the Oculus Rift isn't difficult, even when you don't own one. I'm already a bit experienced with the Oculus Rift SDK as I've helped to develop a small game together with a few friends of mine.

However, if no one is willing to do that (which would be rather sad imho), I'll just go on and do it on my own. It would be great to have someone helping me tho.

Edited March 9, 2015 by codefox
I have an Oculus Rift DK2. My programming knowledge is limited, but I would be willing to help in what ways I can in testing.
